info.title: Slack Web API
info.description: One way to interact with the Slack platform is its HTTP RPC-based Web API, a collection of methods requiring OAuth 2.0-based user, bot, or workspace tokens blessed with related OAuth scopes.

get.description: Checks API calling code.

parameters.name: foo
parameters.description: example property to return

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: Error response to return

get.description: Returns list of permissions this app has on a team.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `none`

200.description: Standard success response when used with a user token

default.description: Standard failure response when used with an invalid token

get.description: Allows an app to request additional scopes

parameters.name: scopes
parameters.description: A comma separated list of scopes to request for

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `none`

parameters.name: trigger_id
parameters.description: Token used to trigger the permissions API

200.description: Standard success response when used with a user token

default.description: Standard failure response when trigger_id is invalid

parameters.name: token

parameters.name: limit

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text of the message to send.

parameters.name: token

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Channel to send message to. Can be a public channel, private group or IM channel. Can be an encoded ID, or a name.

post.description: Sends an ephemeral message to a user in a channel.

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text of the message to send. See below for an explanation of [formatting](#formatting). This field is usually required, unless you're providing only `attachments` instead.

parameters.name: link_names
parameters.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

parameters.name: parse
parameters.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `none`. See [below](#formatting).

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `chat:write`

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: `id` of the user who will receive the ephemeral message. The user should be in the channel specified by the `channel` argument.

parameters.name: as_user
parameters.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed bot. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name.

post.description: Sends a message to a channel.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Set your bot's user name. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to false, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

parameters.name: thread_ts
parameters.description: Provide another message's `ts` value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's `ts` value; use its parent instead.

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

parameters.name: unfurl_links
parameters.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text of the message to send. See below for an explanation of [formatting](#formatting). This field is usually required, unless you're providing only `attachments` instead. Provide no more than 40,000 characters or [risk truncation](/changelog/2018-04-truncating-really-long-messages).

parameters.name: unfurl_media
parameters.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

parameters.name: parse
parameters.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `none`. See [below](#formatting).

parameters.name: as_user
parameters.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user, instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `chat:write`

parameters.name: mrkdwn
parameters.description: Disable Slack markup parsing by setting to `false`. Enabled by default.

parameters.name: icon_emoji
parameters.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides `icon_url`. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to `false`, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

parameters.name: link_names
parameters.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

parameters.name: icon_url
parameters.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to false, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name. See [below](#channels) for more details.

parameters.name: reply_broadcast
parameters.description: Used in conjunction with `thread_ts` and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to `false`.

default.description: Typical error response if too many attachments are included

post.description: Provide custom unfurl behavior for user-posted URLs

parameters.name: user_auth_message
parameters.description: Provide a simply-formatted string to send as an ephemeral message to the user as invitation to authenticate further and enable full unfurling behavior

parameters.name: user_auth_required
parameters.description: Set to `true` or `1` to indicate the user must install your Slack app to trigger unfurls for this domain

parameters.name: unfurls
parameters.description: URL-encoded JSON map with keys set to URLs featured in the the message, pointing to their unfurl message attachments.

parameters.name: ts
parameters.description: Timestamp of the message to add unfurl behavior to.

parameters.name: user_auth_url
parameters.description: Send users to this custom URL where they will complete authentication in your app to fully trigger unfurling. Value should be properly URL-encoded.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `links:write`

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Channel ID of the message

post.description: Updates a message.

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string. This field is required when not presenting `text`.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: New text for the message, using the [default formatting rules](/docs/formatting). It's not required when presenting `attachments`.

parameters.name: ts
parameters.description: Timestamp of the message to be updated.

parameters.name: parse
parameters.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `client`, unlike `chat.postMessage`. See [below](#formatting).

parameters.name: as_user
parameters.description: Pass true to update the message as the authed user. [Bot users](/bot-users) in this context are considered authed users.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `chat:write`

parameters.name: link_names
parameters.description: Find and link channel names and usernames. Defaults to `none`. See [below](#formatting).

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Channel containing the message to be updated.

get.description: Lists & filters team files.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Filter files appearing in a specific channel, indicated by its ID.

parameters.name: ts_to
parameters.description: Filter files created before this timestamp (inclusive).

parameters.name: ts_from
parameters.description: Filter files created after this timestamp (inclusive).

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Authentication token. Requires scope: `files:read`

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Filter files created by a single user.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description:
Filter files by type:

* `all` - All files
* `spaces` - Posts
* `snippets` - Snippets
* `images` - Image files
* `gdocs` - Google docs
* `zips` - Zip files
* `pdfs` - PDF files

You can pass multiple values in the types argument, like `types=spaces,snippets`.The default value is `all`, which does not filter the list.
